timeline.message:
Some Optimizations around BytesArray

* Faster `equals` and `hashCode` for `BytesArray` which is nice since with this change we use it for the search cache
* Lighter `StreamInput` for `BytesArray` that should save memory and some indirection relative to the one on the abstract bytes reference
* Lighter `writeTo` implementation
* Build a `BytesArray` instead of a PagedBytesReference whenever possible to save indirection and memory

timeline.bodyText: I think this is well worth the optimization to not allocating anything for equals and hashCode since we use BytesArray as keys in request caches.
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: Taking advantage of the now cheaper writeTo for the BytesArray + this is always cheaper since we never cleverly batch up writes from multiple components anyway
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: Why have another step going to the byte[] through ByteArray when we don't have to, especially with the new optimizations for that case in here.
timeline.author: original-brownbear
